ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Pseudohypoacusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Confirmed by lack of shadow curve (crossover) in unmasked testing, significant SRT/PTA discrepancy (SRT 25 dB better), and positive Stenger test.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Noise-induced hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Underlying organic loss is likely mild given the history of blast trauma and 4 kHz notch in the right ear, supported by MCIL predictions.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Initial assessment of hearing sensitivity following blast trauma.
Follow-up evaluation to monitor hearing status.
Diagnostic evaluation for legal documentation; assesses thresholds and crossover.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition; checks for agreement with pure-tone thresholds.
To identify pseudohypoacusis in cases of unilateral hearing loss.
To estimate true organic thresholds in the pseudohypacusic ear.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial evaluation by a general practitioner showed normal hearing in the right ear and severe-to-profound loss in the left ear. No masking was used, raising questions about validity.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear thresholds 0-10 dB HL; Left ear thresholds 70-110 dB HL. No masking used.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Follow-up evaluation showed poor test-retest reliability compared to the first visit, with continued severe-to-profound loss in the left ear and no masking used.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear normal; Left ear severe-to-profound loss with variability from V1. No masking used.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Diagnostic evaluation revealed significant inconsistencies indicating pseudohypoacusis. The absence of a shadow curve, a large SRT/PTA discrepancy, and a positive Stenger test confirmed the diagnosis. MCIL testing suggested true thresholds are likely mild.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: RE normal with 4 kHz notch. LE unmasked thresholds 75-85 dB HL with no shadow curve (crossover) observed.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: LE SRT 55 dB HL, significantly better (25 dB) than the PTA of 80 dB HL. WRS 62%.

tests.name: Stenger Test
tests.result_summary: Positive at 500 Hz and 4000 Hz; patient failed to respond to bilateral stimulation when signal was louder in the 'bad' ear but softer than voluntary threshold.

tests.name: Minimum Contralateral Interference Levels (MCIL)
tests.result_summary: Predicted true thresholds of 15-20 dB HL at 500 Hz and 30-35 dB HL at 4000 Hz.

counseling_actions: Discuss inconsistencies between tone and speech results with the patient
Explain that specialized testing indicates hearing is likely in the mild range rather than severe
Emphasize the need for accurate physiological thresholds for legal documentation

escalation.rationale_short: Referral for objective testing (likely electrophysiological) to confirm true hearing thresholds given the diagnosis of pseudohypoacusis.

follow_up_plan.objective: To obtain valid organic hearing thresholds via objective measures.
